column4: Ive read all the command line basic tuts but none of them go into detail
I did
didnt run it
how do I do via command line?
Firefox, but I downloaded via the software center
no manual entry for command line
ok if I found something in a directory, how do I open it?
or run?
Is there a way to get info about things in a directory?

... http://www.linuxcommand.org/ ... while it might not give instant answers, it leads you step by step through all terminal commands and gives you ways to find stuff using the terminal ... A great starters guide that helped me a lot (shame that I won't be needing any longer, since my computer obviously doesn't work with Linux. Who'd have thunk it, a machine, not compatible with Linux ..)
ok cool
I've been looking for a good resource
:) I like that resource ... would like it more, if I had a Linux to go with it :P
but all the places I have tried have been very minimal and don't go into any detial or really explain anything, its all the basic commands like ls, cd, what '~' means etc..
w7 isnt bad no

it hasnt really given me much trouble, I always used osx before using windows, but have been rather familiar with it before, but now that I have ubuntu installed I probalby wont use win7 much more except for work
I love photoshop far too much to give it up
it's horrible when it comes to security and viruses :( ... tried to get a pc of a friend fixed and win7 didn't give me ANY controle whatsoever over changing/adding/removing files, etc.
Pain in the neck ...
Photoshop wouldn't work with Linux_
I know ps wont work, I've seen gimp but I love photoshop too much
gimp is cool cause you can use MIDI with it
